page.title: 14 Religion
page.content: Our area is not only divided between urban and rural zones but also between Catholic and Protestant zones. Some areas of Belfast have been traditionally dominated by one or other of the{religious}groups but since the start of the current {'troubles'}in 1969 such divisions have become more rigid. The majority of the population of our area is Catholic and is divided from the Protestant area by a so-called{'peace-line'.}In some places this takes the form of a high fence; in others it is represented by the two sides of a main road while in other places an area of derelict housing marks the boundary between the two communities. Both sides tend to keep themselves to themselves with religion being closely tied to{Loyalism }(Protestant) and{Republicanism}(Catholic).
